item.title: Kingdom’s Return: Time-Eating Fruit and the Ancient Monster ‘Gameplay’ trailer, details, and screenshots
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Switch 2
  • Xbox Series

Game loop and progression explained.

Inti Creates has released a new trailer, information, and screenshots for hybrid 2D action and strategy game Kingdom’s Return: Time-Eating Fruit and the Ancient Monster, detailing the game loop and progression.

Here are the details:

■ Kingdom’s Return: Time-Eating Fruit and the Ancient Monster

Kingdom’s Return is an action RPG where players must adventure to restore their fallen kingdom. Collect materials in 2D side-scrolling adventure stages, then use them in the strategy part to build your city as you see fit, and powering up your characters in the process!

Choose from one of four characters, Imperial, Alchemist, Wizard, or Zipangu, and set out on adventure through a variety of action stages. Collect the materials here you’ll use to build up your kingdom, placing buildings that buff your characters’ stats. Then set out again to conquer even more dangerous stages, until the bosses are afraid of you.

  • ❮
  • ❯

■ Gameplay Details

To solve the mystery behind the kingdom’s ruin, take on missions and set off for adventure!

Explore the world, and you’ll see monsters roaming around. You can either avoid them or seek out battles aggressively. By battling monsters, you’ll earn materials to use back at your kingdom.

Defeating enemies will also earn you experience points, raising the level of your adventurer. Leveling up will increase your parameters and make you stronger. You’ll also earn CP to spend on your Class Circle to unlock new abilities!

Succeed on your mission, and you can take your hard earned materials home with you safely.

In the strategy part of the game, use the materials you’ve gathered to build structures and restore the kingdom. Even from a lowly start, adventurers will get stronger and stronger by restoring their kingdom and adventuring.

Raise your levels on missions and set out on new adventures! Depending on how you build the kingdom and take on requests from residents, you can even change the ending of the story!

Kingdom’s Return: Time-Eating Fruit and the Ancient Monster is due out for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch 2, Switch, and PC via Steam on April 23.

Watch the trailer below. View the screenshots at the gallery.

Gameplay Introduction Trailer



https://www.gematsu.com/2026/01/kingdoms-return-time-eating-fruit-and-the-ancient-monster-gameplay-trailer-details-and-screenshots

item.title: Fantasista Asuka launches February 12
item.content:encoded:
■ About

Become the coach of a women’s soccer team and lead them to victory!

In this real-time soccer sim, play as the coach of a women’s soccer team tasked with guiding your eccentric players towards victory!
Gameplay for matches is simple and approachable, consisting of quick time events. Unlock new players and power up your team by winning heated matches against your rivals!

In addition, look forward to some mind-blowing rules you definitely won’t find in a real soccer match!
Draft your convention-busting dream team and shoot for the win!

■ Story

A chance encounter brings together Daisuke Aozora, a coach with ambitions to train a Japanese women’s soccer team that can compete on the world stage, and Asuka Tenma, a player from the bottom-ranked soccer club, the Golden Balls.

Seeing potential in Asuka, Daisuke decides to coach for the Golden Balls.

“I’ll guide you from the weakest to the strongest.”

From that one chance encounter… From that one promise… Asuka and her teammates’ fates begin to change.

The bottom-rank team’s miracle run…! Strap in for a soccer underdog epic filled with passion and perseverance!

■ System

Direct Your Players to Victory!

Players will constantly move on the pitch, with each of the player’s decisions greatly swaying the outcome of a match!
The plethora of actions available to the player such as shooting, tackling, and passing change depending on the situation and consume an energy called “vibes.” Overworking a single player will quickly cause them to run out vibes, greatly limiting their moves.

Utilizing substitutions and a division of labour, optimize your team’s output of vibes! Doing so is the shortest path to achieving victory.

Stack Wins and Draft the Ultimate Dream Team!

Winning a fierce match against a rival team will recruit its players into the Golden Balls! Additionally, characters can be powered up between matches through training.

Whether to build a solid all-round team or to focus on a specific niche, the strategy is all up to you, the coach. Train up your favorite players and create your very own dream team! Lead your team to hold up the league champion trophy!

Powerful Special Moves! Leaving Uniforms in Tatters?!

Specific players have special moves which are more powerful than regular shooting, dribbling, and tackling!

However, since they consume large amounts of vibes, figuring out the pivotal moments in which to activate these abilities is the key to victory. When a player lands a special move, their uniform is for some reason left in tatters!

Players with damaged uniforms must temporarily leave the pitch in order to change, leaving your team a player short! Determine when to optimally use your special moves to grasp victory!

No Hard Feelings! The Heartfelt Uniform Exchange!

When you defeat a rival team, exchange uniforms after the match in an act of sportsmanship! It is a sign of friendship and mutual respect only open to those who gave their all during the match. But no weird looks! Those who do will be handed an immediate red card and be asked to leave!

Let the Light Protect You! No More Red Cards on Social Media!

A heavenly light beams down to protect the maidens’ sensitive areas! Turn this feature on and you can elegantly dodge getting a red card on video streaming services or social media…maybe!

*Please note that even with this feature enabled, there is still a possibility that a platform will remove your video or ban your account.

■ Feature Comparisons

The features listed below will look different depending on the platform.

  • Uniform Exchange Illustrations
    • Switch – Amount of Skin Showing: Small
    • PC – Amount of Skin Showing: Large
  • Uniform Destruction Illustrations
    • Switch – Amount of Skin Showing: Small
    • PC – Amount of Skin Showing: Large

Watch a gameplay video below.



https://www.gematsu.com/2026/01/fantasista-asuka-launches-february-12

item.title: Mario Kart World version 1.5.0 update now available
item.content:encoded:
• Switch 2

Adds team races to Knockout Tour when playing in a room during online and wireless play.

Nintendo has released the version 1.5.0 update for Mario Kart World, which adds team races to Knockout Tour when playing in a room during online and wireless play.

Here are the full patch notes:

General

  • Added team races to Knockout Tour when playing in a room during “Online Play” and “Wireless Play.”
  • The game now supports the Polish language.
    • Note: You can change your selected language using the “Language” setting in the “System” menu of “System Settings.”

Fixed Issues

  • Fixed an issue where the game would sometimes end if a player plays as Kamek on Choco Mountain.
  • Fixed an issue where the displayed rating would sometimes be incorrect when joining “Everyone” in “Online Play” while in a room.
  • Several other issues have been addressed to improve the gameplay experience.

Mario Kart World is available now for Switch 2.



https://www.gematsu.com/2026/01/mario-kart-world-version-1-5-0-update-now-available

item.title: Street Fighter 6 DLC character Alex launches March 17
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Switch 2
  • Xbox Series

Wrestling star Kenny Omega revealed as motion capture actor.

Street Fighter 6 downloadable content character Alex will launch on March 17, Capcom announced. Wrestling star Kenny Omega is the motion capture actor behind Alex’s signature moves.

Get the latest details below.

Alex kicked off his fighting career as the protagonist of Street Fighter III: New Generation in 1997. Since then, his brash disposition has earned him the moniker The Man with No Allies whenever he steps into the ring. After more time refining his technique, Alex has added a new stance, over 10 throws, and new moves that transition seamlessly into one another to make him a fighting force whether he’s in the ring or on the streets.

As shown in the gameplay trailer, Alex’s fierce wrestling techniques include:

  • Flash Axe – A rapid attack with light and medium options. The light version is a great combo ender whereas the medium can transition into Prowler Stance upon hit.
  • Flash Chop – When this bodacious heavy strike hits on the ground, the opponent will be opened up to a follow-up grab like Power Bomb or Oblique Stomp for some wicked damage. The OD version allows Alex to transition to Prowler Stance on hit.
  • Aerial Knee Smash – A fantastic anti-air technique as Alex jumps into the air and slams his opponent into the ground with his knee.
  • Power Bomb – Alex’s signature move comes with light, medium, and heavy variations, which all deal the same damage while offering other unique benefits.
  • Prowler Stance – Alex forfeits the ability to block while in this stance, but gains 11 different follow-up options to mix-up his opponent. For example, if you land Sweep Combination (Target Combo), Hyper Takedown (Throw), or Dangerous Armbar (Throw) on a Punish Counter, they’ll transition into Flying Suplex, Death Valley Bomb, and Spiral DDT respectively.
  • Raging Spear – Alex’s Level 1 Super Art has him spring forward with a devastating tackle. This move is invincible on start-up to both strikes and throws and can also be used in combos.
  • Sledgecross Hammer – Alex’s Level 2 Super Art crushes opponents with a devastating lariat that can wall splat if it hits an airborne opponent and has some invincibility from projectiles.
  • Omega Wing Buster – Alex has another Level 2 Super Art following a successful OD Power Drop where Alex can transition into Omega Wing Buster. If this move looks familiar it might be because wrestling superstar Kenny Omega performed this move’s motion capture for Alex!
  • The Final Prison – Alex’s Level 3 Super Art The Final Prison has four different animations! The wrestler chokes the opponent out with a series of phenomenal grappling moves. There’s the normal Level 3 version, the Level 3 version that results in a K.O., the normal CA version, and a CA version that ends in a K.O.

Alex will be unlocked and ready to throw down for players who own or purchase the Year 3 Character Pass or Year 3 Ultimate Pass on March 17. Alex’s Outfit 1 reflects his role as the Dark Devil of the ring, while Outfit 2 reflects a more classic look from Street Fighter III. Stay tuned for the full release of Alex’s theme song “GO! ALEX! Hope is Born!” composed by anime song super band JAM Project, which can be heard in the gameplay trailer.

Alex joins the already released Year 3 characters Sagat and C. Viper, with Ingrid (Late Spring 2025) waiting in the wings to round out the Year 3 character roster.

  • ❮
  • ❯

Street Fighter 6 is available now for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch 2, PlayStation 4, and PC via Steam.

Watch a new trailer below. View a new set of screenshots at the gallery.

DLC Character Alex Gameplay Trailer

English

Japanese

item.title: Fighting Force Collection launches January 23
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Switch

Two PlayStation classics return.

Fighting Force Collection will launch for PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, Switch, and PC via Steam on January 23, publisher Limited Run Games and developer Implicit Conversions announced.

Here is an overview of the collection, via Limited Run Games:

About

Two PlayStation classics return: Fighting Force and Fighting Force 2!

Fighting Force

Originally released in 1997, this beat ’em up classic let players become Hawk Manson, Mace Daniels, Alana McKendricks, or Ben “Smasher” Johnson as they fight to take down the evil Dr. Dex Zeng.

  • Choose from two male or two female characters, each with different skills and strengths.
  • Play alone or in co-op mode to defeat your enemies.
  • Dozens of moves per character.
  • Seven action packed levels in 22 different stages.
  • Pick up weapons like rocket launchers, shotguns, pipes, guns, grenades and more!

Fighting Force 2

This follow-up released in 1999—in this game, players take the role of Hawk Manson, who is covertly investigating human cloning experiments by the Knackmiche Corporation.

  • Negotiate through complex R&D facilities featuring amazing visuals and advanced special effects.
  • Fierce hand-to-hand combat including deadly combination moves.
  • Use an arsenal of over 20 lethal weapons to assist in removal of key personnel and complete destruction of environments.


https://www.gematsu.com/2026/01/fighting-force-collection-launches-january-23
